abstract.p: Lagardere reports 36.4 percent increase in first-half operating income, to 263 million euros, or $232 million, as revenue increases to 5.9 billion euros from 5.8 billion a year earlier; net profit rises almost sixfold, to 788 million euros (S)

block.p: The French media company Lagardere, best known for its publishing division and magazines, reported a 36.4 percent increase in first-half operating income, to 263 million euros, or $232 million, as revenue increased to 5.9 billion euros from 5.8 billion a year earlier. Net profit soared almost sixfold, to 788 million euros largely on a one-time exceptional gain of 1.1 billion euros related to the sale this year of an Internet service provider, Club Internet, to Deutsche Telekom, and of the publisher Grolier Inc. to the Scholastic Corporation. To focus on the media, Lagardere this year also entered an alliance with Canal Plus, a European pay-for-view television company.
